title: How to Install an OtterBox Defender Series Case on Your iPad

steps.title: Remove the OtterBox case from the shield stand.
steps.content: Remove the OtterBox case from the shield stand. The OtterBox Defender series includes a stand so you can prop your iPad up while using it. To get started with the installation process, remove the stand from the rest of the case by pulling it off at each corner. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Peel off the silicone slipcover.
steps.content: Peel off the silicone slipcover. The case has a soft outer cover that you’ll need to remove. Some models have a tab at the bottom that you may need to release to peel off the cover. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Separate the back of the casing from the front.
steps.content: Separate the back of the casing from the front. This is a little more difficult. You’ll see several tabs along all four sides of the case that you’ll need to unsnap. They’re marked by arrows on the back of the case.

steps.title: Clean your iPad screen and OtterBox screen cover.
steps.content: Clean your iPad screen and OtterBox screen cover. If you have any dust or smudges on your screen or the clear screen protector that comes with your OtterBox, now is a good time to clean them. Apple recommends cleaning an iPad screen with a soft, slightly damp (not wet!) lint-free cloth. [3] X Research source Wipe the OtterBox screen protector down with a soft, slightly damp microfiber cloth. If there’s any stubborn grime, you can use water mixed with a few drops of dish soap. Rinse the cover, pat it dry with a lint-free cloth, and let it air dry before installing it.

steps.title: Put the iPad into the back of the casing.
steps.content: Put the iPad into the back of the casing. It can only go in one way. Make sure to line up the ports, buttons, and camera lens(es) with the correct holes on the case.

steps.title: Snap on the front of the case.
steps.content: Snap on the front of the case. Take care not to smudge the screen cover or trap any hair or lint on the inside surface of the screen protector. Start at the bottom of the screen and work your way around the sides and up to the top. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Put on the outer silicone slipcover.
steps.content: Put on the outer silicone slipcover. This will basically be the reverse of when you peeled it off. Make sure all the ports and holes line up correctly. Press around all the edges to make sure the cover is firmly in place. [5] X Research source Now your iPad is fully protected! If you like, you can also use the shield stand to prop your iPad up. Snap your case into the stand base and adjust the angle by pulling the stand out and towards you.
